column4: Hey, I just installed the package gnochm (chm viewer) from synaptic, and when I run it I get this error: "You do not have all of the required Python modules to run gnochm. ... could not import gtk"
findout what version of pythong gtk it wants
In the readme it says pygtk2 is needed
hmm... you better surf the makers site for help...
I'm thinking this is a bug in the gnochm packaging
where did you got it ? i cant find it with apt-cache...
got a link to chm i can test ?
it also gives that error simply starting it from the terminal
hmm, not here... seems to work...
as i said, gnochm works here... are you using "pure" dapper ?
on a suggestion from somebody on #gnome, I ran 'python -c "import gtk"'. I get this result: http://pastebin.ca/191803.
undefined symbol: cairo_surface_write_to_png_stream hmm, maybe youre missing some python/cairo png librarys...
thanks for your help. I can't figure this out though. I've tried reinstalling python2.4-cairo, but that doesn't fix it.
dunno, it works here with out errors.. but if you have good error/debug logs, a bugreport wouldnt hurt
